result.rationale: Puntius waageni is assessed as Vulnerable due to its restricted distribution with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 10,200 km2, which is threatened by intermittent drought, as well as pollution from industrial, agricultural and urban sources. These threats are resulting in a decline in the available area and quality of the habitat. There is one threat-based location.
result.geographicrange: This species is endemic to the Punjab Province in Pakistan, where it is known from the Chua Saidar Shah (type locality). The species was also collected from the Head Rasool in Chenab River in 2002 (A. Qadir. pers. comm. 2020).
result.population: No information is available on either the status or trend in the population of this species.
result.habitat: This species occurs in shallow streams and springs (Talwar and Jhingran 1991) at an altitude from 200 m to 700 m asl.
result.threats: This species is threatened by intermittent drought, as well as pollution from industrial, agricultural and urban sources, which results in a decline in the available area and quality of the habitat (Xie et al. 2013, Khan 2016, M. Rafique pers. comm. 2020).
result.conservationmeasures: No conservation actions are in place. There is a need to understand the micro-level distribution, population, life history and threats to the species.
result.usetrade: There is insufficient information regarding the use and or trade of this species, and more research is required.
